The '''Libertarian Party of Michigan''' was founded in [[Taylor, Michigan]] in 1972<ref>Salvette, Emily H. [http://mi.lp.org/Shared%20Documents/25thann.htm "The Libertarian Party of Michigan Twenty-Fifth Anniversary Project"]"mi.lp.org" (website)</ref> and remains on the ballot<ref>Jacobs, Dick M. [http://bentley.umich.edu/bhl/mhchome/parties/libertar.htm "Michigan political parties: Libertarian Party"] "bentley.umich.edu" (website)</ref><ref>Libertarian Party of Michigan, [http://mi.lp.org "Official Website"] "mi.lp.org" (website)</ref><ref>Libertarian Party of Michigan, [http://Michiganlp.org "Alternate Libertarian Party of Michigan Website"] "michiganlp.org" (website)</ref> as Michigan’s third oldest active political party.<ref>{{cite news | last =The Associated Press | first = | url = http://www.macombdaily.com/stories/102204/sta_libertar001.shtml | title = Libertarians going in with large slate, low expectations | work = The Macomb Daily | date =October 22, 2004 | accessdate = }}</ref> It is the Michigan affiliate of the [[Libertarian Party of the United States]].<ref>Libertarian National Committee, [http://lp.org "The Party of Principle"] "lp.org" (website)</ref>
==Overview== Since its founding, the Libertarian Party of Michigan has fielded candidates for a variety of offices and has retained its position on the state ballot.<ref name="elections">Land, Terri (Secretary of State). [http://mi.gov/sos/0,1607,7-127-1633---,00.html "Elections in Michigan"] "mi.gov" (website)</ref> In the 2006 general election, the Libertarian Party of Michigan was the only political party in the state to support the successful [[Michigan Civil Rights Initiative]].<ref>{{cite news | first=Scotty | last=Boman | coauthors= | title=Liberty Fest Honors Defenders of Liberty | date=November 21, 2006 | publisher = ''LPM Online'' | url=http://michiganlp.org/ENewsletters/N20061121.htm | accessdate = }}</ref><ref>{{cite news | first=Scotty | last=Boman | coauthors= | title=Liberty Fest Honors Defenders of Liberty | date=November 21, 2006 | publisher = ''LPM Online'' | url=http://lpmich.org/lpmonline/archive/N20061121.php | accessdate = }}</ref><ref>By Any Means Necessary,[http://www.bamn.com/ce/2004/040131-protest-libertarian-party.pdf "PICKET & PROTEST of the MICHIGAN LIBERTARIAN PARTY"]. "bamn.com" (website)</ref> The party's gubernatorial candidate, [[Greg Creswell]],<ref>Creswell, Greg [http://gregcreswell.org "Greg Creswell for Governor"]. "gregcreswell.com" (website)</ref> and his running mate [[Scotty Boman]]<ref>Boman, Scotty [http://scottyboman.org "Scotty Boman for Lt. Governor"]. "scottyboman.com" (website)</ref> made it the centerpiece of their campaigns.<ref name="elections"/> Several Libertarians have held public office in Michigan, most at the local level.<ref name="Lloyd">{{cite news | first=John | last=Michalak | coauthors= | title=A friend to Hazel Park loses battle with lymphoma | date=December 27, 2006 | publisher = ''Daily Tribune'' | url=http://www.dailytribune.com/stories/122706/loc_20061227005.shtml | accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="lpminoffice">Libertarian Party of Michigan, [http://mi.lp.org/Shared%20Documents/officials.aspx "Michigan Libertarians In Office"]"mi.lp.org" (website).</ref>. The party is a member of the [[Michigan Third Parties Coalition]] which advocates changes in Michigan's election laws.<ref>[http://www.mithirdparties.org/pr0001.htm "Michigan Third Parties Coalition Formed"]</ref>
==Libertarians in public office== ===Elected libertarians currently in public office<ref>Libertarian Party of Michigan, [http://michiganlp.org/Shared%20Documents/candidates.aspx "Elections on November 6th"]. "Michiganlp.org" (website)</ref>=== * Councilman Andrew LeCureaux of [[Hazel Park]] <ref>Hazel Park City Government, [http://www.hazelpark.org/elected.htm "Elected Officials"]. "hazelpark.org" (website)</ref>. * Mayor Pro Tem Mark Owen of [[Owosso, Michigan|Owosso]] <ref>Owosso City Government, [http://ci.owosso.mi.us/Government/Overview-Government.htm "Our Local Government"]. "ci.owosso.mi.us" (website)</ref>. * Councilman Bill Bradley City of [[South Haven, Michigan|South Haven]] <ref>South Haven City Government, [http://www.south-haven.com/csh%20folder/csh/Pages/Council.html "City Council Members"]. "south-haven.com" (website)</ref>. * Another Libertarian elected to office in Michigan was David Eisenbacher who has returned<ref>{{cite news | first=Terry | last=Oparka | coauthors= | title=Troy incumbents prevail — the slate does not | date=November 7, 2007 | publisher = ''C & G newspapers'' | url=http://www.candgnews.com/Homepage-Articles/2007/11-7-07/TG-ELECTION.asp | accessdate = }}</ref> the Troy City Council.<ref>{{cite news | first=John | last=Michalak | coauthors= | title=Troy eyes prayer policy | date=March 29, 2005 | publisher = ''Daily Tribune'' | url=http://www.dailytribune.com/stories/032905/loc_20050329012.shtml | accessdate = }}</ref><ref>Eisenbacher, David [http://www.eisenbacher.org/] "eisenbacher.org" (website)</ref><ref>{{cite news | first=Greg | last=Dirasian | coauthors= | title=Eisenbacher Wins!!! | date=April 2, 2002 | publisher = ''LPM Online'' | url=http://www.mi.lp.org/lpmonline/archive/N20020402.shtml | accessdate = }}</ref> * Park Commissioner Lawrence W. Johnson of [[Ypsilanti Township]] was elected in 2008 on a partisan ballot<ref name="ipr112708">{{cite news | first=Bill | last=Hall | coauthors= | title=Libertarian Party of Michigan November election highlights | date=November 27, 2008 | publisher = Independent Political Report | url= http://www.independentpoliticalreport.com/2008/11/libertarian-party-of-michigan-november-election-highlights | accessdate = | language = }}</ref>.
=== Former elected libertarians === Former elected Libertarians include: * Mayor Pro Tem <ref name="Stahl">Stahl, Erin [http://www.erinstahl.com "Erin Stahl for St. Clair Shores City Council"]. "erinstahl" (website)</ref> Erin Stahl<ref>St. Clair Shores City Government, [http://www.ci.saint-clair-shores.mi.us/admin/council/right.htm "St. Clair Shores City Council" ]. "ci.saint-clair-shores.mi.us" (website)</ref> of [[St. Clair Shores]], * Fred Collins, who served as Councilman for the City of Berkley, Michigan <ref>Libertarian Party National Committee, [http://www.lp.org/organization/history.shtml "Our History"]. "lp.org" (website)</ref><ref>The Libertarian Party of Virginia,[http://www.lpva.com/Archives/News/2001/20011112electionResults.shtml "59 Libertarians elected to local office in nine states"] "lpva.com" (website)</ref><ref>{{cite news | first=Melanie | last=Hunter | coauthors=Deputy Managing Editor | title=Libertarian, Green, Independent Party Candidates Hold Debate in NYC | year=2004 | publisher = ''CNSNews.com'' | url=http://www.crosswalk.com/1282287 | accessdate = }}</ref><ref>THIRTIETH COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF BERKLEY, [http://www.berkleymich.org/Calendar/eventsCal/Uploads/081505.pdf "THE THIRTY-FOURTH MEETING OF THE THIRTIETH COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF BERKLEY, MICHIGAN"]. "berkleymich.org" (website)</ref> from 1997 until he gave up his position to run for Mayor in 2005, and lost the election.<ref>Berkley City Government, [http://www.berkleymich.org/web/2005ElectionResults.asp "2005 Election Results"] "berkleymich.org" (website)</ref> * Councilman Mark Byrne<ref>{{cite news | last =MURPHY | first = SHANNON | url = http://thetimesherald.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20071107/NEWS01/711070303 | title = A vote for change: Former police captain earns most votes in council race | publisher = "Times Herald" | date =November 7, 2007 | accessdate = }}</ref>. who is now active with Unifour Area Libertarian Party in North Carolina. * Park Commissioner Tom Bagwell of [[Ypsilanti Township]] was elected in 2008 on a partisan ballot<ref name="ipr112708"/>, but left office after moving from [[Ypsilanti Township]].
=== Libertarians appointed to public office === * Lloyd Sherman (died December 25, 2006) - Hazel Park Brownfield Authority, Hazel Park Facilities and Infrastructure Citizens Advisory Board, Hazel Park Fence Review Board, Hazel Park Zoning Board of Appeals, Hazel Park General Building Authority.<ref name="Lloyd" /><ref name="lpminoffice"/> * Will Tyler White Vice-Chair Meridian Charter Township Economic Development Corporation (EDC)<ref name="lpminoffice"/><ref>Meridian Township Board, [http://www.meridian.mi.us/meetings/tb/minutes050505.htm "CHARTER TOWNSHIP OF MERIDIAN TOWNSHIP BOARD REGULAR MEETING"] "meridian.mi.us" (website)</ref> * Donald Flatt - Commissioner, Portage Parks and Recreation Board.<ref name="lpminoffice"/><ref>Brennan, Ryan [http://users.rcn.com/k.brennan/libertariansinoffice.html "Libertarian Party: Number of Libertarians in Office: 601+"] "ThirdPartyNews.net" (website)</ref> * Steven Butler - Co-Chair, Grand Rapids Environmental Mandates Committee.<ref name="lpminoffice"/> * James McAbee - Romeo Planning Commission<ref name="lpminoffice"/> * Darrell Johnson - Berkley City Planning Commission<ref name="lpminoffice"/>
== Defender of Liberty Awards == [[Image:LPM 2007 Dender of Liberty Award Winners.jpg|thumb|250px|Libertarian Party of Michigan 2007 Defender of Liberty Award Winners (Leslie Roszman, Michigan for Ron Paul; Scott Boman, LPM activist; and Republican Martin Howrylak, Troy City Council)<ref>{{cite news | first=Greg | last=Stempfle | coauthors= | title=Campaign Conference Recap | date=May/June, 2002 | publisher = Michigan Libertarian | url=http://mi.lp.org/Past%20Newsletters/Michigan%20Libertarian%20Vol%2037.3%202008%20May-June%20COLOR.pdf | accessdate = }}</ref>]] "Defender of Liberty" Awards ("Libbies") have been presented by the Libertarian Party of Michigan at its annual LibertyFest Banquet to a maximum of four select individuals, Libertarian or otherwise, whom the LPM believes have made notable personal efforts in the defense of liberty. Winners must live and/or work in the state of Michigan. The Libertarian Party of Michigan lists three subcategories for the award:<ref name="Libby">Libertarian Party of Michigan [http://mi.lp.org/Shared%20Documents/LibertyFest.aspx Defender of Liberty Awards]. "mi.lp.org" (Website).</ref> * Spokesperson for Liberty - a member of the community whose patriotism and conviction have inspired contributions to the cause of Liberty * Promoter of Liberty - A Libertarian whose efforts have done the most to promote the LP and Libertarian principles * Producer of Liberty - a dedicated, behind-the-scenes Libertarian whose quiet labors over the years exemplifies the backbone of the LP.<ref name="Libby" />
